summary: The Pipeline Security Act (H.R. 5062) amends the Implementing Recommendations of the 9/11 Commission Act of 2007. It codifies the Transportation Security Administration's (TSA) responsibility for securing pipeline transportation and facilities against cybersecurity threats, terrorism, and other security risks. The bill mandates the TSA to create guidelines, directives, and regulations; share information; assess risks; and conduct inspections. It also requires the TSA to develop a personnel strategy and report to Congress. The Comptroller General will review the Act's implementation.
